materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 458 Purple and 1 ball 012 Black
One dozen 12” (30.5 cm) pipe cleaners or chenille stems
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bat measures 2” [5 cm] wide.
gauge: 12 hdc = 1” [2.5 cm]; 5 rows hdc = 1” [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 1
Floating Bats 
Headband
Perfect for wearing to an upcoming party, or 
anywhere you might be this Halloween. Create 
bats with a bit of crochet thread, stiffen them 
and then attach to a headband with chenille 
stems. Bewitching!

Second Wing
With Right side facing, attach thread in the 
back loop of the third dc from the second ear.
Rows 1-4: Work same as for First Wing. 
Fasten off and weave in ends.

FINISHING
Stiffen Bats using decoupage sealer or a 
mixture of half white glue and half water. 
Soak each piece in the stiffener, blot the 
excess, then pin to a blocking board or padded 
surface, being sure the picots and wing tips 
are sharp and stand out.
After pieces are dry, wrap the headband with 
4-5 pipe cleaners or chenille stems to cover
it. Insert one of the wires through the center
of a Bat, bending the wire tip back to hold the
Bat in place. Referring to photo for placement,
leave a length of 3 to 5 inches of wire before
wrapping the rest of the wire around the
headband to secure it. Repeat with the rest of
the Bats, alternating colors.

Note
Work all stitches in the back loop only unless 
otherwise indicated.

BAT (Make 3 Purple and 2 Black)
Make an Adjustable Loop and ch 3 (counts  
as dc).
Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 dc in ring, picot 
(first ear), 2 dc in ring, picot (second ear), 10 
dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 to 
join—19 dc. Leave a small opening in the 
center of the ring so there is room to insert 
a pipe cleaner or chenille stem later. Do not 
fasten off; continue to make First Wing.

First Wing
Row 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and 
throughout), hdc in same beginning st, 2 hdc 
in each of next 3 dc; turn—8 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in same beginning st, hdc 
in each of next 6 hdc, 2 hdc in top of ch-2; 
turn—10 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in same beginning st, 2 hdc 
in next hdc, hdc in each of next 6 hdc, 2 hdc in 
each of next hdc and top of ch-2; turn—14 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in same beginning st, picot, 
* hdc in next 4 hdc, picot; repeat from * twice,
hdc in top of ch-2—15 hdc, 4 picots. Fasten
off and weave in ends.

Designed by Cristina Mershon

materials: Caron® Latte Cakes® (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: One size to fit Adult. Approx 4¾" [12 cm] wide.
gauge: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: With A, ch 14. Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc. Row 1: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row for Rib Pat until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm], ending on a WS row and joining B to last st. Break A. With B, cont in Rib Pat until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off. FINISHING: Lay Headband on flat surface with RS facing up. Bring up each short edge to meet in middle. Fold Color A short edge to form a “C” shape and B short edge to form a backwards “C” shape, and interlock as shown in Diagram. Sew ends tog using whipstitch.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 312 Black for Kitty
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 341 Light Grey A and 724 Baby Pink B for Mouse
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EEK! A MOUSE!
Ear Back (Make 2)
With A, ch 3, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2 – 24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Fasten off.
Ear Front (Make 2)
With B, work as for Ear Back through Round 4. Change to A and complete Round 5. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides together, sew Ear Front to Ear Back leaving approximately 1” (3 cm) unsewn. Turn Ears right side out. Cut and position a length of wire to fit around inside edges of each Ear. Secure ends together and slip wire inside each Ear to hold shape. Position lower edge of each Ear evenly spaced apart on headband and sew on securely. Weave in ends.
Note
1. Kitty Ears are worked in two pieces from lower edge to tip. Two Ears are then sewn together and stuffed with fiberfill. Lower edge is sewn onto a purchased headband.
2. Mouse Ears are worked in continuous rounds from center to outside edges.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
KITTY, KITTY
Ears (Make 4)
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 7 sc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, turn – 5 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn – 3 sc.
Row 7: Repeat Row 2.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc3tog.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew 2 Ears together, leaving beginning edge unsewn. Lightly stuff with fiberfill sew closed. Repeat with second Ear. Position lower edge of each Ear evenly spaced apart on headband and sew on securely. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A, and 334 Buff B.
Seed beads in red and copper in two sizes
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Motifs sewn together measure 7” across at widest point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
MOTIF (Make 2)
With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 12 sc ring, slip st in first st to join – 12 sc. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc, 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in same sc, *hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 32 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc] 4 times, (2 hdc, ch 2, 2 hdc) in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, hdc in same next hdc, [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc] 4 times, (2 hdc, ch 2, 2 hdc) in next hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail on one motif.
Trim
With right side of one Motif facing, join B in any st and slip st in each hdc around, slip st in first st. Fasten off. Repeat on second Motif.
FINISHING
Position one Motif overlapping Motif with long tail end by 1½”. Position feather trim down center of right side of lower Motif, slipping end in overlap, and sew to lower Motif. Using long tail, sew Motifs together. Arrange beads in center of upper Motif and sew in place.
Ties
With right side facing, join B in center of point of one Motif, make a ch 15” long. Fasten off. Repeat to make a Tie on opposite point of joined Motifs. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9590 Lavender A and 9700 Baby Pink B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Flower measures 3” (7.5 cm) in diameter.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
FLOWER (make 2)
First Petal Layer
With A, ch 4.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join and in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, hdc in same st as join, 2 dc in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, slip st in next sc (petal made), *hdc in next sc, 2 dc in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1, slip st in next sc (petal made); repeat from * around, ending with last slip st in last slip st of Rnd 2—6 petals. Fasten off.
2nd Petal Layer
With B, ch 4.
Round 1 (right side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in same st as join, 2 dc in next dc (petal made), *ch 1, (slip st, ch 1, hdc) in next dc, 2 dc in next dc (petal made); repeat from * around; join with slip st in beginning ch—6 petals. Fasten off.
3rd Petal Layer
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join (petal made), *ch 1, (slip st, ch 1, 2 sc) in next sc (petal made); repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—6 petals. Fasten off.
Centerpiece
Leaving a long beginning tail, with B, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave ending tail through back loop of each st; pull gently but tightly to close.
FINISHING
Stack layers of petals with first petal layer on bottom and 3rd petal layer on top. Pull tails of centerpiece though center of Round 1 of all layers, tie a knot and secure on wrong side of first petal layer. Sew to top bar of comb between teeth.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Plus™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 78 yds/71 m) Cream (56001) or Pink Dusk (56005) 1 ball
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Standard elastic hair ties approx 11/2" [4 cm] in diameter.
measurements: To cover standard elastic hair tie 11/2” [4 cm] in diameter.
gauge: SUPER BULKY 6
instructions:
Notes:
• A tutorial video is available here.
• The first hdc may twist around hair tie, so you might need to pull through first two loops, and then adjust work before pulling through final loop. 
Make a slip knot and insert hook into slip knot. Yoh and insert hook through center of hair tie. Yoh and pull up a loop through center of hair tie. Yoh and pull through all three loops on hook. 
Work in hdc loosely around hair tie, sliding finished sts tog tightly. 
Cont until desired fullness is reached (approx 30 to 35 sts.)
Join with sl st to first hdc of rnd. 
Cut yarn, leaving a 6" [15 cm] tail, and fasten off. Tie starting and finishing ends tog into a tight square knot. Clip ends close to knot.

materials: RED HEART® Stardust:  2 skeins 1805 Blue A; 1 skein 1623 Green B.
abbreviations: 3-hdc cluster (cl) = [Yo, insert hook in space, yo, draw yarn through st] 3 times in same space, yo, draw yarn through 7 loops on hook.

Foundation single crochet (fsc) = First St: Ch 2, insert hook under top 2 strands of first ch, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops (first fsc complete). Remaining sts: Insert hook under both loops of previous st, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops.
NOTE: Chain 2 counts as hdc throughout. All stitches are worked into the top and the back loop of the indicated stitch to form a ridge in the completed row.
measurements: Scarf measures 4½” wide x 48” long; Headband measures: 4” wide x 18 ½ (20)” long.
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCARF
With A, fsc 24; ch 1, turn to work into sc side of foundation ch.
Row 1: Hdc in the next 2 sts, *ch 1, skip next st, cl in next st, ch 1, skip next st, hdc in the next 5 sts; repeat from * once; ch 1, skip next st, cl in the next st, skip next st, hdc in the next 3 sts; ch 2, turn – 3 cl, 6 ch-1 spaces, 16 hdc sts.
Row 2: Hdc in the next 2 sts, *cl in ch-1 space, ch 1, cl in the next ch-1 space, hdc in the next 5 sts; repeat from * once; cl in ch-1 space, ch 1, cl in the next ch-1 space, hdc in the next 3 sts; ch 2, turn – 6 cl, 3 ch-1 spaces, 16 hdc sts.
Repeat Rows 1 and 2 following the scarf stripe sequence until scarf measures 48 inches long. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Scarf Stripe Sequence: Work 9 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 3 rows with A, 3 rows with B, *15 rows with A, 7 rows with B, 15 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 3 rows with A, 3 rows with B, repeat from * three times, then 9 rows with A.
FINISHING
Fringe
Cut 12 10” long strands of A and B* Holding 2 strands of A and 2 strands of B together, fold in half. Insert hook in first ch of foundation row, pull up loop, then pull all strands through loop. Skip 3 ch and repeat from * 5 times. Attach fringe to the stitches on the opposite end of scarf in the same manner.
Create this matching hat and headband with a little sparkle. It is made with two colors using a super fine weight yarn. Perfect for Fall, Winter or Spring.

HEADBAND
With A, fsc 20; ch 2, turn to work into sc side of foundation ch.
Row 1: Hdc in the next 4 sts, *ch 1, skip next st, cl in the next st, ch 1, skip next st, hdc in the next 5 sts; repeat from * across; ch 2, turn – 2 cl, 4 ch-1 spaces, 15 hdc sts.
Row 2: Hdc in the next 4 sts, *cl in the next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next st, cl in the next ch-1 space, hdc in the next 5 sts; repeat from * across; ch 2, turn – 4 cl, 2 ch-1 spaces, 15 hdc sts.
Repeat Rows 1 and 2 following the headband stripe sequence until piece measures 18½” (20”) long. Fasten off.
Headband Stripe Sequence: For 18½” (20”) headband, work 9 (12) rows with A, 3 rows with B, 3 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 9 rows with A, 9 rows with B, 9 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 3 rows with A, 3 rows with B, 9 (12) rows with A.
Lining
With A, fsc 20; ch 3, turn to work into sc side of foundation ch.
Row 1: Dc in each st across; ch 3, turn – 20 sts
Repeat Row 1 until piece measures 18½” (20”) long. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, sew long edges of both pieces together. Turn inside out. Sew ends of lining edge together, inserting needle in each st on each end. Sew the outside edges together in the same manner. Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (10.5 oz/300 g; 400 yds/436 m) White (10040) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) and US 12 (1 mm) steel crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bead = Draw up a loop to the width of the pearl, drop the loop from the hook, insert smaller hook into pearl and then into the dropped loop, pull thread loop through the pearl adjusting so that the pearl is even with the previous ch-1. Ch 1. remove smaller hook from loop and insert larger hook to proceed
measurements: Headdress fits most women.
gauge: 32 dc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With larger hook, ch 120. Join with sl st to form a ring, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. *2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Skip first sc. 1 dc in next sc and each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 5. Skip first 2 sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5. 72 ch-2 sps.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 6. Skip next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 ch-6 loops.
6th rnd: Sl st in each of next 3 ch. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-6 loop. Ch 10. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Sl st in next 5 ch. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 10) 5 times. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. Bead. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 10) 4 times. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. (Bead) 3 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 10) 3 times. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. (Bead) 5 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 10) twice. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. (Bead) 7 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 10. 1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. (Bead) 9 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-10 loop. Ch 1. (Bead) 11 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Stardust™: 1 ball each 1805 Blue A and 1623 Green B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hairnet circumference at lower edge: 24” wide.
gauge: 16 dc = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
GAUGE: 16 dc = 4”; 8 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. 
Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
NOTE: Hat is worked from center to brim.
Special Abbreviations
dtr (treble crochet): Yarn over 3 times, insert hook in st, 
draw up a loop (5 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw 
through 2 loops] 4 times.
dtr2tog: *Yarn over 3 times and insert the hook in next st, 
[yarn over and draw through 2 loops] 3 times; repeat from * 
once more, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. 

HAIRNET
With A, ch 6, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 5 (counts as tr here and throughout), work 
19 tr in first ch, slip st to top of beginning ch – 20 tr.
Round 2: Ch 8 (counts at dtr and ch 3), [dtr in next tr, ch 3] 
19 times, slip st in 5th ch of beginning ch – 20 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 5 (counts as dtr here 
and throughout), dtr in same space, ch 6, [dtr2tog in next 
ch-3 space, ch 6] 19 times, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 4: Slip st to center of first ch-6 space, ch 1, sc in 
same space, [ch 8, sc in next ch-6 space] 19 times, ch 4, tr 
in first sc (counts as ch 6 space and sc) – 20 ch-6 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 9, [sc in next ch-8 space, 
ch 9] 19 times, slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 10, [sc in next ch-9 
space, ch 10), slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Ch 3, (counts as dc here and throughout), *9 dc 
in next ch-10 space, dc in next sc; repeat from 18 more 
times, 9 dc in last ch-10 space, slip st in first sc – 200 dc.
Fasten off.
Round 8: Join B in any st, ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip 
st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 9-10: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, skip 2 dc, dc in 
next 3 dc; repeat from * to last 2 dc, ch 2, skip 2 dc, slip st 
in top of beginning ch.
Round 11: Ch 3, dc in each dc and ch around, slip st in 
top of beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 3, dc in next 7 dc, *skip next dc, dc in next 
5 dc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 
167 dc.
Round 13: Ch 2, hdc in next st, *skip next st, hdc in next 
4 sts; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 
134 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 2, *skip next st, hdc in next 3 sts, skip next 
st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 18 more times, slip st in 
top of beginning ch – 96 hdc.
Round 15: Ch 3, dc in next 2 hdc, *ch 1, skip next 2 hdc, 
dc in next 3 hdc; repeat from * around to last st, skip last 
hdc, slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 16: Ch 3, dc in each dc and ch-1 space around, 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Weave in ends.
Drawstring Tie
With 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 150, Fasten off.
Beginning and ending at back of Hair Net, weave 
Drawstring Tie through ch-1 spaces of Round 15.
RED HEART® Stardust™ Art. E783, 
available in tweed with metallic 1.76 oz 
(50g), 191 yd (175m) balls.

materials: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A and 520 Minty B
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = [Insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop] twice; yarn over and draw through all three loops on hook – 1 stitch decreased.
inc (increase) = work 2 sc into the same stitch.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Measurements are not explicitly stated.
gauge: 14 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 9 sc rows = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
With A, slip st around hair tie; ch 1. Round 1: Work 50 sc around hair tie; join with slip st to 1st sc – 50 sc. Cut A. Join B to any st with a slip st. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 2 sts, dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st, join with slip st to 1st sc. Fasten off. 

Note: Work with both colors at once, carrying the color that is not being used along the row by crocheting over it. At the end of each row, pull the unused color taut to tighten up the edges. Begin the next row 'ch 1' with the new color for that row. 

With A, ch 2. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn – 1 sc. Row 2: With B, ch 1, inc, turn – 2 sc. Row 3: With A, ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn – 3 sc. Row 4: With B, repeat Row 3 – 4 sc. Row 5: With A, repeat Row 3 – 5 sc. Row 6: With B, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Row 7: With A, repeat Row 6. Row 8: With B, repeat Row 6. Row 9: With A, ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc. Row 10: With B, repeat Row 9 – 3 sc. Row 11: With A, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Repeat Row 11 until tie measures 5½" (14 cm) long, ending after working a B row. Row 12: With A, ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc. Row 13: With B, repeat Row 12 – 5 sc. Row 14: With A, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Row 15: With B, repeat Row 14. Row 16: With A, repeat Row 14. Row 17: With B, ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc. Row 18: With A, repeat Row 17 – 3 sc. Row 19: With B, repeat Row 17 – 2 sc. Row 20: With A, ch 1, dec – 1 sc. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Knot Tie over the first 4 sc of Round 2 on Scrunchie.

SOLID COLOR SCRUNCHIE
With A or B, slip st around hair tie; ch 1. Round 1: Work 50 sc around hair tie; join with slip st to 1st sc – 50 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 2 sts, dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st, join with slip st to 1st sc – 10 hdc, 18 dc, 18 tr, 4 sc. Fasten off. 

Tie
Ch 2. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn – 1 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, inc, turn – 2 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn. Rows 4–5: Repeat Row 3 – 5 sc. Rows 6–8: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Row 9: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc. Row 10: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 3 sc. Row 11: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Repeat Row 11 until tie measures 5½" (14 cm) long. Rows 12–13: Ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn. Rows 14–16: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. Row 17: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc. Rows 18–19: Repeat Row 17 – 2 sc. Row 20: Ch 1, dec – 1 sc. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Knot Tie around first 4 sc of Round 2 on Scrunchie.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Sashay™: 1 Ball 1937 Mambo.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Barrette measures 5” across.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: [Chain 12, slip st in first chain] 8 times. Fasten off. Attach Barrette to back of Flower. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 528 Medium Purple A, 886 Blue B, 672 Spring Green C, 324 Bright Yellow D, 254 Pumpkin E, 319 Cherry Red F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.5mm [US 7] and 3.5mm [US E-4]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Headband circumference: 16 (18, 20)" [40 (46, 51) cm]
gauge: 16 dc = 4" (10 cm); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm) in double crochet using larger hook. Circle = 3" (7.5 cm) using smaller hook.
instructions:
HEADBAND 
With larger hook and A, ch 60 (72, 84), slip st in first ch to form a ring
Round 1: Linked first-dc in slip st (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around, change to B, slip st in first dc of rnd.
Round 2: Linked first-dc in slip st, dc in same st, *dc in next 3 dc, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, [2 dc in next dc] twice; repeat from * around to last 11 sts, dc in next 3 dc, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in last dc, change to C, slip st in first dc.
Round 3: Linked first-dc in slip st, dc in same st, *dc in next 3 dc, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, [2 dc in next dc] twice; repeat from * around to last 11 sts, dc in next 3 dc, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in last dc, change to D, slip st in first dc.
Round 4: With D, repeat Round 3, changing to E in last st.
Round 5: With E, repeat Round 3, changing to F in last st.
Round 6: With F, repeat Round 3 without changing color in last st. Fasten off. 
CIRCLE MOTIF
With smaller hook and D, make an adjustable loop. 
Round 1: Working in ring, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 23 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 24 dc.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), [dc in next dc, ch 1] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4.
Round 3: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [working over next 2 ch-1 spaces, dc2tog, ch 3] around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-6. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Sew Circle Motif to headband. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Classic™: 1 skein each 0003 Off White A and 681 Mist Green B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = [Insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop] twice; yarn over and draw through all three loops on hook – 1 stitch decreased.
inc (increase) = work 2 sc into the same stitch.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Tie measures 5½" (14 cm) long.
gauge: 14 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 9 sc rows = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A or B, slip st around hair tie; ch 1. 
Round 1: Work 50 sc around hair tie; join with slip st to 1st sc – 50 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 2 sts, dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st, join with slip st to 1st sc – 10 hdc, 18 dc, 18 tr, 4 sc.
Fasten off.
Tie
Ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn – 1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, inc, turn – 2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn. 
Rows 4–5: Repeat Row 3 – 5 sc.
Rows 6–8: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn. 
Row 9: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 3 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn.
Repeat Row 11 until tie measures 5½" (14 cm) long.
Rows 12–13: Ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn.
Rows 14–16: Ch 1, sc to end of row, turn.
Row 17: Ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc.
Rows 18–19: Repeat Row 17 – 2 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, dec – 1 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Knot Tie around first 4 sc of Round 2 on Scrunchie.
STRIPED SCRUNCHIE
With A, slip st around hair tie; ch 1. 
Round 1: Work 50 sc around hair tie; join with slip st to 1st sc – 50 sc.
Cut A. Join B to any st with a slip st. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts, *hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 2 sts, dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st, join with slip st to 1st sc. 
Fasten off.
Tie
Note: Work with both colors at once, carrying the color that is not being used along the row by crocheting over it. At the end of each row, pull the unused color taut to tighten up the edges. Begin the next row “ch 1” with the new color for that row.
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn – 1 sc.
Row 2: With B, ch 1, inc, turn – 2 sc. 
Row 3: With A, ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn – 3 sc.
Row 4: With B, repeat Row 3 – 4 sc. 
Row 5: With A, repeat Row 3 – 5 sc. 
Row 6: With B, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn.
Row 7: With A, repeat Row 6.
Row 8: With B, repeat Row 6.
Row 9: With A, ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc.
Row 10: With B, repeat Row 9 – 3 sc. 
Row 11: With A, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn.
Repeat Row 11 until tie measures 5½" (14 cm) long, ending after working a B row. 
Row 12: With A, ch 1, inc, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc.
Row 13: With B, repeat Row 12 – 5 sc. 
Row 14: With A, ch 1, sc to end of row, turn.
Row 15: With B, repeat Row 14.
Row 16: With A, repeat Row 14.
Row 17: With B, ch 1, dec, sc to end of row, turn – 4 sc.
Row 18: With A, repeat Row 17 – 3 sc. 
Row 19: With B, repeat Row 17 – 2 sc. 
Row 20: With A, ch 1, dec – 1 sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.
Knot Tie over the first 4 sc of Round 2 on Scrunchie.

pattern_name: Stitch Club Cozy Twisted Crochet Headband
materials: Patons ® Norse™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 211 yds /193 m) Periwinkle (91016) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit adult. Approx 4¾" [12 cm] wide.
gauge: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Chain (Ch) 14. Foundation row: (RS). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc. 1st row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Repeat (Rep) last row for Rib Pattern (Pat) until work from beginning (beg) measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a Wrong Side (WS) row. Fasten off. FINISHING Lay Headband on flat surface with RS facing up. Bring up each short edge to meet in middle. Fold first short edge to form a "C" shape and second short edge to form a backwards "C" shape, and interlock as shown in Diagram. Sew ends tog using whipstitch.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Magical™: 1 Ball each 1101 Crystal Ball A and 1406 Hocus Pocus B.
measurements: Headband measures 4” wide x 18½” long, excluding Ties.
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 6 rows = 4” with 1 strand of A and B held together.
instructions:
HEADBAND
With 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 12. 
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across – 10 dc. 
Rows 2-26: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, ddc in each dc across – 10 dc. 
Fasten off. 
FINSHING
Ties
Top Row (Right Side): With 1 strand of A and B held together, ch 28, slip st in 6th st on last row of Headband, sc in each st across to first corner, ch 1, turn to work along long edge, sc evenly spaced to opposite short edge, ch 1, turn to work along short edge and sc in each st to 6th st, ch 28. 
Fasten off. 
Bottom Row (Wrong Side): With 1 strand of A and B held together, join yarn in same st as first st of Top Row, ch 1, sc in each unworked st of short end to first corner, ch 1, turn to work along opposite long edge of Headband, sc evenly spaced along long edge to opposite short edge, ch 1, turn to work along short edge, sc in each unworked st to center st, slip st in center st. 
Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 368 Paddy Green A and 0316 Soft White B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
One ½” (13 mm) wide headband (such as Bow-tique-Horizon Group headband, shown)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Headband measures ½” (13 mm) wide
gauge: 4 sts = 1” (2.5 cm); 3 rows sc = 3/4” (2 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HEADBAND COVER
Top Half
With A, ch 55.  
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn—54 sts
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Bottom Half
With B, work same as Top Half. Fasten off.
With wrong sides of Top and Bottom Halves facing, using yarn needle and A, sew sides together, matching sts. Insert the headband into cover. Sew ends together. Weave in ends.
Clover (make 2)
With A, ch 4, join into a ring with a slip st in first ch.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring, join with a slip st in first sc.
Rnd 2: *Ch 3, (tr, hdc) in same st, (hdc, tr, ch 3, slip st) in next st**, slip st in next st; repeat from * once; repeat from * to ** once, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in each of next 3 ch, slip st in base of first st (stem made). Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew both Clovers on the left side of the headband as pictured.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 424 Light Peach A, 661 Frosty Green B, 210 Antique White C, and 275 Coral D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Headband measures 20” (51 cm) circumference, without trailing leaves.
gauge: 1 flower = 7/8” (2 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEADBAND
First Flower
With A, ch 5. 
Round 1 (right side): (3-dc Cl, ch 4, slip st) in 5th ch from hook, [ch 4, 3-dc Cl, ch 4, slip st] 3 times in same ch, ch 1; change to B and cut A. 
Stem and Leaves 
Row 1: Ch 9, make leaf, ch 10, make leaf, ch 3; change to C; drop, but do not cut, B.
Second Flower
Round 1 (right side): Ch 6, (3-dc Cl, ch 4, slip st) in 5th ch from hook, [ch 4, 3-dc Cl, ch 4, slip st] 3 times in same ch; change to B and cut C.
TRAILING LEAVES
Row 1: With wrong side of first flower facing, join B with slip st in last slip st, ch 16, make leaf, ch 14, make leaf, ch 12, make leaf, ch 14, make leaf, ch 16, make leaf, ch 12, make leaf, ch 20, make leaf, ch 6, make leaf. Fasten off.
Row 2: With wrong side of last flower facing, join B with slip st in last slip st, ch 12, make leaf, ch 16, make leaf, ch 14, make leaf, ch 20, make leaf, ch 12, make leaf, ch 14, make leaf, ch 16, make leaf, ch 6, make leaf. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Gently tighten beginning and end tails of threads to ensure that chains at color changes are uniform in size and tension. Weave in ends. Secure in wearer’s hair with bobby pins.
Special Stitches
3-dc Cl (3 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
make leaf = sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, slip st in next ch; leave remaining ch unworked.
Notes
1. Do not fasten off B thread at the end of each set of stem and leaves. Carry behind each flower until next needed.
2. To change color, work last chain of old color. Yarn over with new color and draw through loop on hook to complete first chain. Proceed with new color. Cut old color unless otherwise instructed.

abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into indicated stitch
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Headband measures 4” wide (including ruffle), length is varied to fit.
gauge: 22 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in double crochet using smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEADBAND
Ch 18.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each remaining ch across, turn—16 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), skip first dc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 7 times working the last dc in top of turning ch, turn—9 dc and 7 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first ch-1 space, 2 dc in each of next 6 ch-1 spaces, 2 dc in space between last dc and turning ch, turn—16 dc.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until piece, slightly stretched, fits around head (covering ears). Sew or slip st last row to first row to form a ring.
Round 1: With Right Side facing and larger hook, join yarn with sc in end of Row 2, ch 5, sc in end of same row, *ch 5, sc in end of next row, ch 5, (sc, ch 5, sc) in end of next row; repeat from * around, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Repeat around other side edge.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball RED HEART® Soft Essentials™ 7851 Navy
measurements: Headband measures 21" [53.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 16.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped 3 ch count as first dc), dc in each ch to end – 14 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, working in back loops only, dc in each dc to end – 14 dc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 21" [53.5 cm] from beginning.
Joining Row: Fold piece in half, lining up sts of foundation ch with sts of last row, working through both layers, sc in each st across to join. Fasten off.
TIE 
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 6.5" [16.5 cm] from beginning.
Wrap Tie around seam of Headband to gather slightly. Repeat Joining Row to join short ends. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

abbreviations: M1 (Make 1 stitch) = Knit into purl “bump” behind next st on left needle.
ssk (slip, slip, knit) = Slip next 2 sts knitwise, one at a time, to right needle; insert point of left needle into the fronts of these 2 sts and knit them together from this position.
St st = Stockinette stitch (Knit on right side rows; Purl on wrong side rows.)
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: One size fits most adults. Band length: 22”. Width at widest point: 3½”.
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 26 rows = 4” in St st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEADBAND
Cast on 7 sts.
Rows 1-3: Slip 1 wyif, knit to end.
Row 4 (Wrong Side): Slip 1 wyif, K1, purl to last 2 sts, K2.
Row 5: Slip 1 wyif, knit to end.
Repeat Rows 4 and 5 until piece measures 2” from beginning, ending with a wrong side row.
Increase Row (Right Side): Slip 1 wyif, K1, M1, knit to last 2 sts, M1, K2 – 9 sts.
Repeat Increase Row every 4th row 3 more times – 15 sts. Work even until piece measures 6½” from beginning, then work Increase Row once more – 17 sts. Work even until piece measures 15” from beginning, ending with a wrong side row.
Decrease Row (Right Side): Slip 1 wyif, K1, K2tog, knit to last 4 sts, ssk, K2 – 15 sts.
Repeat Decrease Row every 4th row 4 more times – 7 sts. Work even for approximately 2” more. Try on headband and add or remove rows at this point so that ends of headband barely meet at back of neck when slightly stretched. Work 1 more row if necessary to end with a wrong side row.
Buttonhole Row (Right Side): Slip 1 wyif, K2, yo, K2tog, K2. Work 3 rows even. Repeat last 4 rows once more. Bind off.

Flower
With crochet hook, ch 5; join with a slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2), [dc in ring, ch 2] 5 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Round 2: [(Sc, hdc, dc, tr, dc, hdc, sc) in ch-2 space] 6 times – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working into dc from Round 1 and holding petals in front, [sc in dc, ch 3] 6 times; join to first sc.
Round 4: [(Sc, hdc, dc, 3 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in ch-3 space] 6 times – 6 petals.
Round 5: Working into sc from Round 3 and holding petals in front, [sc in sc, ch 4] 6 times; join.
Round 6: [(Sc, hdc, dc, 5 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in ch-4 space] 6 times – 6 petals. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew flower to wide portion of headband. Sew button to end of band opposite buttonholes. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® With Love® (7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m) Blue Hawaii (1803) or Iced Aqua (1502) or Cameo (1711) 1 ball
Note: 1 ball will make approx 66 Flowers, 50 Bows or 20 Pompoms.
Flower and Bow Versions: Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Super glue. Snap-on hair clips.
Pompom Version: 2" [5 cm] wide piece of cardboard. Super glue. Snap-on hair clips.
measurements: Flower: Approx 2" [5 cm] diameter. Bow: Approx 2" x 3" [5 x 7.5 cm]. Pompom: Approx 2" [5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FLOWER
Ch 18.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd row: [Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. Ch 1. Sl st in next ch – petal made] 3 times. [Ch 2. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch – petal made] 5 times. 8 petals. Fasten oﬀ leaving long end.
With RS facing up, roll petals inward as shown in picture and secure spiral on WS with yarn end.
BOW
Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal “bump” at back of each ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 9 sc.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 1½" [4 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten oﬀ or turn at end of last row.
Edging: With RS facing, ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Bow, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten oﬀ.
Tie: Wrap length of yarn around center of Bow 10 times and secure tightly.
POMPOM
Wind yarn around cardboard approx 75 times. Remove from cardboard and tie tightly in center, leaving 2 long ends for attaching to hair clip. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape.
FINISHING
Glue a Flower, Bow or Pom-Pom to each snap-on hair clip as shown in photo.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.0 mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Headband measures: 18½" (47 cm) long by 1½" (4 cm) wide, not including Ties.
gauge: 7 rows in pattern = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Tie 1
With A, Ch 33; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; do not fasten off—32 ch.
Band
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to make ring.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc now and throughout), (3 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in ring; turn—8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in ch-2 space, skip 3 dc, dc in top of ch-3; turn—8 dc.
Rows 3-32: Repeat Row 2.
Tie 2: Ch 1, slip st in first 3 dc and ch-2 space, ch 33; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 31 ch; join with slip st in ch-2 space. Fasten off.
HEART (make 1 with A, 2 with B)
Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1).
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook; join with slip st in top of ch-4—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in same st as join, sc in next 2 dc, hdc in next dc, 2 dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 2, slip st in next dc, ch 2, 2 dc in each of next 2 dc, hdc in next dc, sc in next 2 dc, join with slip st in first sc—18 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, sew Hearts to Headband; weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 1 ball 1944 Harvest Moon
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [J-10 US]
Sewing needle and matching thread (optional for buttons)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Headband measures 3” x 22” (7.5 x 56 cm), unbuttoned
gauge: 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Buttoned Crochet Headband
You don’t have to worry about the headband not being the right size…just place the buttons at your perfect comfort place! Crocheted in yarn with a bit of sparkle, you’ll love wearing this comfy headband.
Round 32: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 33: Sc2tog 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—3 sc.
Row 34: Sc3tog—1 sc. Do not fasten off.
Buttonhole Loop Row: Ch 12, working in back bars, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Second Side
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to first ch of foundation ch.
Round 1: Working across opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 2–34 and Buttonhole Loop Row: Repeat Rounds 2–34 Buttonhole Loop Row of first side.
FINISHING HEADBAND
To form buttonhole loop, sew end of buttonhole loop row to Row 34 of first side. Repeat for second side.
CINCHING BAND
Ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd and last ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—8 sc.
Rows 11 and 12: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 13: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Rows 15 and 16: Repeat last 2 rows—4 sc.
Headband measures 3” x 22” (7.5 x 56 cm), unbuttoned.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Headband is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
2. Cinching band is worked in rows, wrapped around headband at midsection, and tacked in place.
3. Buttonholes cross at back of headband and loop over buttons. Buttons are worn at nape of neck.
HEADBAND
First Side
Ch 24; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first sc in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back bars, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2–22: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog twice, sc to last 5 sc, sc2tog twice, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 25–30: Repeat last 2 rounds 3 times—8 sc.
Round 31: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®, Art. E786, Available in 2.5 oz  (70 g), 153 yd (140 m) balls.
Designed by Nancy Anderson.
What you will need:
RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 1 ball 1944 Harvest Moon.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [J-10 US].
Yarn needle, stitch marker, two 11/8” (28.5 mm) wooden buttons, sewing needle and matching thread (optional for buttons).
GAUGE: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm);
Row 17: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, gather midsection of headband by weaving length of yarn in and out, pulling tightly, and securing. Wrap the cinching band around the gathered section and sew ends together; tack band in place to underside of headband. Center each button on top side 6” (15 cm) (or at desired distance) from end of each buttonhole loop and sew in place with strand of yarn or matching thread. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 177 yds/194 m) in Bergamot (61009) or Coal (61025) - 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: One size to fit Adult. Approx 4" [10 cm] wide.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

MAKE THIS
Make a slip knot and place on hook.
Slip Knot: Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.
Chain: Yarn over hook. Pull yarn through loop on hook - Chain made.

Continue until 9 chains have been made.
1st row: 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Single crochet: Insert hook in second chain from hook. Yarn over hook. Draw yarn through chain. 2 loops now on hook. Yarn over hook. Draw yarn through both loops on hook - Single crochet made.

1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 stitches (sts).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Repeat (Rep) 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures 19½" [49.5 cm]. Fasten off. Lay work on a flat surface to measure.

Finishing
Lay Headband on flat surface with Right Side (RS) facing up. Bring up each short edge to meet in middle. Fold one short edge to form a 'C' shape and the other short edge to form a backwards 'C' shape, and interlock as shown in Diagram. Sew ends tog (together) using whipstitch.

With WS together, sew through both pieces to secure the beg of seam, leaving an end to weave in later. Insert needle from back to front through 2 strands on each piece. Bring needle around and insert it from back to front through next strands on both pieces. Rep along edge.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Cherry Red (319) 1 ball or 32 yds/29 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Bow
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc.
7th to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
11th row: As 3rd row.
12th row: As 11th row. 5 sts.
13th row: As 3rd row.
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 3 sts. Turn.
15th row: As 3rd row.
16th to 29th rows: Rep 2nd to 15th rows once more.
Fasten off.
Bow Center
Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. 8 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
FINISHING
Fold sides of Bow towards center, aligning final row against foundation row. Sew ends tog. Wrap Bow Center around Bow and sew ends tog securely (WS of Bow).

I-Cord Headband
Ch 3.
1st row: Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in 3rd ch from hook. 3 loops on hook.
2nd row: Drop last 2 loops off hook, pinching them securely with left hand to avoid dropping loops. Yoh and draw up a loop in rem loop on hook. (Place next dropped loop on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop) twice.
Rep 2nd row until I-Cord Headband measures head circumference when slightly stretched.
Final row: Yoh and draw loop through all 3 ch. 1 loop rem on hook. Fasten off. Sew ends tog.
Sew Bow in position to cover seam of I-cord.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m) Cuddly Cloud (86018) or Restful Rose (86002) or Bunny Brown (86028) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Whdc = (Wide Half Double Crochet) Yoh and draw up a loop in space between stitches of previous row. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Customisable to fit Child (Adult). (See page 2 for Size Chart.)
gauge: 16 hdc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for the larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Ch 16 (20). 1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 14 (18) hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. In the first sp to the left of post, 1 whdc. 1 whdc in each sp to end of row, placing final whdc between last st and turning ch. Turn. Rep 2nd row until Headband measures 19½" [49.5 cm] for an average Woman’s size head or to desired size. Note: Make headband 3" [7.5 cm] less than your head circumference. Finishing: Step 1: Lay Headband out and fold in half. Slide one side of Headband across so one corner is matched up to the middle of the other edge. Step 2: Fold the right hand side around the back. Step 3: Fold the left hand side around the front, giving you 4 layers Step 4: Sew with yarn needle through all four layers. Knot ends tog and clip. AVERAGE HEAD CIRCUMFERENCE Preemie 12-13" [30.5-33 cm] Newborn - 3 Months 13-14" [33 cm - 35.5 cm] 3-6 Months 14-15" [35.5 cm - 38 cm] 6-12 Months 15.5-16.5" [39.5 cm - 42 cm] 12-24 Months 16-18" [40.5 cm - 45.5 cm] Child (3-10 years) 19-21" [48.5 - 53.5 cm] Teen/Small Adult 21" [53.5 cm] Medium Adult 22" [56 cm] Large Adult 23" [58.5 cm]

gauge: 11 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 14.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
1st row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for Rib Pat until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm], ending on a WS row and joining B to last st. Break A.
With B, cont in Rib Pat until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Lay Headband on flat surface with RS facing up. Bring up each short edge to meet in middle. Fold Color A short edge to form a “C” shape and B short edge to form a backwards “C” shape, and interlock as shown in Diagram. Sew ends tog using whipstitch.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 3620 Glowworm A, 722 Pretty ‘n Pink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
3 Bling Bling Beads (#SUL 51576, Clubhouse Crafts, Advantus Corp.)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st

measurements: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm), in single crochet. 4 shells = 5” (12.5 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm), in shell pattern.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm), in single crochet.
instructions:
HEADBAND
With A, ch 55.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—54 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Wrap piece around ½” (13 mm) headband and sew long edges together. Position the seam on the inside of the headband. Sew the ends of piece together. Weave in ends.
Flowers (make 3)
With B, ch 17.
Row 1: (Sc, dc, sc) in 2nd ch from hook, (sc, dc, sc) in each remaining ch across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Wind strip into a layered circle (beginning of layered circle is center of flower). Sew flower together at center. Add a bead for decoration. Sew the three flowers to top of headband.

materials: Caron® Simply SoftTM (Ombres: 4 oz/113 g; 204 yds/186 m; Solids:  6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Main Color (MC) Grape Purple (08315), Teal Zeal (08701), Cafe Latte Brown (08012) or Saturday Blue Jeans (08114)
Contrast A Fuchsia (39764), Chartreuse (39771), Soft Pink (39719) or White (39701)
Scarf and Headband: Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Fingerless Gloves: Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Scarf: Approx 7 x 60” [18 x 152.5 cm]. Headband and Fingerless Gloves: One size to fit average woman.
gauge: Scarf and Headband: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook. Fingerless Gloves: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook.
instructions:
SCARF
See Diagram 1 on page 3. 
With MC and size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) hook, ch 32.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. [(1 dc. Ch 2) twice. 1 dc] all in next ch – Shell made. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn.
1st row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). 1 dc in first sc. *Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc (top of Shell). Skip next ch 2-sp and dc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * to last Shell. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Shell in next sc. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. 1 sc in top of next dc. Skip next dc and ch-2 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Shell in next sc. 1 sc in 2nd ch of turning ch 5. Turn.
Last 2 rows form pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures 60” [152.5 cm], ending with a RS row.
Fasten off.
HEADBAND
With MC and size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) hook, ch 14.
Work in pat, as given for Scarf until Headband measures 19½” [49.5 cm].
Fasten off. Sew short ends tog.
FLOWERS (make 3).
See Diagram 2 on page 3. 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in last sc. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: *Ch 3. Sl st in back loop of next sc, keeping ch to back of work. Rep from * around.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 5 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to back loop of ch 1.
5th rnd: *Ch 5. Sl st in back loop of next ch 1, keeping ch to back of work. Rep from * around.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 7 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to back loop of ch 1. Fasten off.
Sew Flowers to Headband and Scarf as shown.
FINGERLESS GLOVES
CUFF
With MC and size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) hook, ch 2. 
1st row: (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row to 27 sts. (Straight sides measure approx 5” [12.5 cm]).
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first sc and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows twice more.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first sc and next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Sc2tog over last ch-1 sp and last sc. Turn.
Rep last row until 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Pull up a loop in first sc, next ch-1 sp and last sc. Yoh and pull through all 4 loops on hook - sc3tog made. Fasten off.
Sew side seam.
Join MC with sl st to top of cuff at side seam.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 21 sc evenly around top of cuff. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sc at end of 4th rnd.
5th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

materials: AUNT LYDIA'S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 0001S White/Silver
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Comb measures 4" wide by 1 3/4" high [10 cm x 4.5 cm]
gauge: Rounds 1-4 of Large Flower = 1 5/8" [4 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
LARGE FLOWER
Leaving long tail, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc, *ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc, ch 3; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, *[ch 3, tr] 2 times in same space, ch 3, slip st in same space,** slip st in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 times, then from * to ** once; do not join.
Round 4: Ch 1, fpsc around first sc of Round 2, *4 sc in next ch-3 space, 5 sc in next ch-3 space, 4 sc in next ch-3 space,** fpsc around next sc of Round 2; repeat from * 4 times, then from * to ** once, slip st in first fpsc to join. Fasten off and weave in ends.

LEAF (MAKE 2)
Ch 6, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join; (ch 2, 4-dc cl, ch-3 picot, ch 3, slip st) in same sc.
Round 2: Ch 3, sc in top loop of 3rd ch from hook; working in back loop only of each st, sc in next 5 sc, ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next 5 sc; slip st in first sc of Round 1; ch 3, turn.
Round 3 (Wrong Side): Sc in top loop of 3rd ch from hook; working in front loop only of each st, sc in next 5 sc, sc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, sc in same space, sc in next 5 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, ch 3, turn.
Round 4: Sc in top loop of 3rd ch from hook; working in back loop only of each st, sc in next 6 sc, sc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, sc in same ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, ch 3, turn.
Round 5: Sc in top loop of 3rd ch from hook; working in front loop only of each st, sc in next 6 sc, slip st in next ch-2 space; leave remaining sts unworked, ch 3. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

STAR FLOWER
Leaving long tail, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc, *(2 dc, tr, ch-3 picot, 2 dc) in next sc,** sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, then from * to ** once, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off and weave in ends.

SMALL FLOWER
Leaving long tail, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 3] 12 times, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off and weave in ends.

SPIRAL BUD (MAKE 3)
Ch 9, working in top loop of each ch throughout, 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in each of next 7 chs. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Thread tail on tapestry needle and weave it up through center of the spiral, then catch first sc of the 5-sc on the needle and pass it back through center to secure tail.

FINISHING
Lay thread end across top of the Comb, secure by wrapping thread around top of the Comb, 6-7 wraps between each tooth and over thread. (Add 1 or 2 wraps around ends if needed.) Referring to photo for placement, attach Leaves and Flowers by sewing through wraps on the Comb. Sew a Leaf to each end of the Comb. Sew the center of the Large Flower to the Comb, but do not sew down the petals. Sew the center of the Star Flower to the Comb. Sew the Small Flower to the Comb, slightly tucked under the petals of the Star Flower. Sew the Spirals on: one in the center of the Large Flower, one under the Small Flower, and one between the petals of the Star Flower. Weave in all ends.

Crochet chain 14 stitches. Working in the top loop of each chain work 6 double crochets in the fourth chain from the hook. Work 7 double crochets in each remaining chain (there should be ten more chains left.) Keep your hook in the final loop. You should have a nice curlicue shape. With the crochet hook in a loop at the top of the curlicue, chain 30 more stitches. Now you are going to create another curlicue. Work 6 double crochets in the fourth chain from the hook. Work 7 double crochets in the next 10 chain stitches. There should be about 15 chain stitches in between the curlicues. Use this area to tie around a pony tail. Cut the yarn off, pull the yarn through the final yarn loop and finish the project by weaving the loose string through the curlicue. Please note: You can tie this around a pony tail like a hair bow. You can make matching curlicue hair bows for pig tails. If you want a longer curlicue just plan to do the double crochets over a few more chain stitches. You will need fewer chain stitches if you want a short curlicue. These can be made into key chains and book marks.

pattern_name: Puffy Flower Crochet Headband & Hair Clips
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Craft Kit Gradients™ - 1 kit
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Hairband = Approx 12" [30.5 cm] long, excluding ties. Hairclips = Approx 2½" [6 cm] diameter for Flower, excluding clips.
gauge: Puffy Flower Motif = Approx 2½" [6 cm] diameter.
instructions:
PUFFY FLOWER MOTIF
With Color 1, ch 2, leaving a tail approx 3" [7.5 cm] long, 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to any sc. 
Fasten off Color 1, leaving a tail approx 3" [7.5 cm] long.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. *Ch 3 (counts 
as dc). Yoh and draw up a long loop, equal in height 
to beg ch 3. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 
6 times all in same sc as sl st. Yoh and draw through 
6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops. 
Ch 3. Sl st in same sc – Petal Cluster made. Sl st in next 
sc. Rep from * 5 times more. Sl st in same sc as first 
sl st. Fasten off, leaving a 3" [7.5 cm] long tail for assembly.  
6 petals total.

HAIRBAND
For all Versions, use A as Color 1, and make 2 Puffy Flower 
Motifs each with B and C as Color 2 and 1 Puffy Flower Motif 
with D as Color 2.

Assembly
On WS of each Motif, pull ends of Color 1 to close hole, and 
tie ends tog tightly to secure.
With WS facing, join Motifs tog at tips of petals, using yarn 
needa and tails from fasten off to sew them tog into 1 strip 
of 5 Puffy Flower Motifs in following sequence: B, C, D, C, B.

Ties
With RS facing, join A with sl st to last Puffy Flower Motif, 
between petals.
Ch 50. Fasten off.
Rep on other end.

With yarn needle, weave in ends on WS of work.

HAIR CLIPS
Make Puffy Flower Motif for each Clip.
For Each Version use D as Color 1 and A as Color 2.

Notes:
• When joining and fastening off each color, leave a 
tail approx. 3" [7.5 cm] long to tie and secure on WS 
during finishing.
• Tie ends tog tightly on WS to secure and weave ends 
into petals and trimming to hide.
Glue Motif to Hair Clip.

Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] deep x 22" [56 cm] long, excluding ties.

instructions:
See diagram on page 2.
Ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in ring. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp (corner). Ch 1. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) to beg ch 3. 3 dc in top of beg ch. Turn.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9401 Elephant A, 9702 Strawberry B, and 9590 Lavender C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [H-8 US] and 6mm [J-10 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
= repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
HEADBAND
With smaller hook and A, ch 9 tightly.
Row 1: Slip st in 6th ch from hook, ch 3, skip next 2 ch, slip st in last ch; turn—2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3, slip st in first ch-space, ch 3, slip st in next ch-space; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until headband measures 10 (13, 16)” [25.5 (33, 40.5) cm] long. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

FLOWER
With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
Round 1 (wrong side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 2 (right side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Do not turn.
Round 3: Working in front loops only, (slip st, 2 hdc, dc, tr, ch 1, tr, dc, 2 hdc, slip st) in first sc, slip st in next sc, *(slip st, 2 hdc, dc, tr, ch 1, tr, dc, 2 hdc, slip st) in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around—6 small petals. Do not join in first st. Fasten off.

CENTERPIECE
With smaller hook and A, make a small adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, *[yo, insert hook in ring, pull up a loop, yo, draw through 2 loops] 4 times (5 loops on hook); yo, draw through all 5 loops; repeat from * twice. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Gently pull beginning tail to close ring tightly. Weave end tail through tops of loops and pull gently to form a ball.

FINISHING
Sew short ends of headband together. Thread tails of centerpiece through Round 1 of flower and then through headband so flower covers seam. Secure flower in place. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Headband is 22” long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 17 rows = 4” with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEADBAND
With larger hook, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 5 sts.
Rows 2-8: Work even.
Row 9-Inc: Ch 1, 2 sc in 1st st, sc across to last st, 2 sc in last st; turn – 7 sts.
Rows 10-33: Repeat Rows 2-9 three times – 13 sts.
Rows 34-52: Work even.
Row 53-Dec: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 11 sts.
Rows 54-60: Work even.
Rows 61-84: Repeat Rows 53-60 three times – 5 sts.
Rows 85-92: Work even.
Try on Headband. Ends should barely meet at back of neck when slightly stretched; add or remove rows until Headband fits. Work 1 row even.
Next Row-Buttonhole: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, ch 1, skip next st, sc in next 2 sts; turn. Work 3 rows even.
Next Row: Repeat Buttonhole row. Work 2 rows even.
FINISHING
Ch 1, sc evenly around edge of Headband; join to first st. Fasten off.
FLOWER
With smaller hook, ch 5; join with a slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2), [dc, ch 2] 5 times in ring; join to 3rd ch.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc, tr, dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-2 space around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Holding Round 2 forward, *sc in dc from Round 1, ch 3; repeat from * around; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc, 3 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-3 space around – 6 petals.
Round 5: Holding Round 4 forward, *sc in sc from Round 3, ch 4; repeat from * around; join.
Round 6: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, dc, 5 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-4 space around – 6 petals. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Flower to wide portion of Headband. Sew button to end opposite buttonholes. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m) Rice Paper (00100)
Bernat® Sheepish™ (3 oz/85 g; 167 yds/153 m) Grey(ish) (00003)
Version 1: Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Version 2: Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit average woman's head.
gauge: Version 1: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Version 2: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Version 1
Ch 12.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. 
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
First Section
Join yarn with sl st to first unworked st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Join pieces: Next row: Ch 3 (counts as d c). 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Cross first section beneath second section just worked. Work 1 dc in each of next 5 dc of first section. Turn. 10 dc.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew ends tog.
Version 2
Ch 18.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 16 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. 
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
First Section
Join yarn with sl st to first unworked st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Join pieces: Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Cross first section beneath second section just worked. Work 1 dc in each of next 8 dc of first section. Turn. 16 dc.
Next row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew ends tog.

measurements: Headband measures approximately 1" wide.
gauge: 12 sts = 4"; 13 rows = 4" in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASIC STRIP 
Ch 4. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch; turn – 3 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. 
Repeat Row 2 until desired length. Fasten off. 
 
HEADBAND 
Make the Basic Strip approximately 18" long. Check to see that it will fit comfortably, with a little bit of stretching, around the head at the desired position before fastening off. Fasten off leaving a yarn tail of about 10". 
Thread the yarn tail into the yarn needle and sew the ends of the first and last rows together, being careful that the strip is not twisted. 
For a little more pizzazz: 
• weave one or two strands of contrasting color yarn through the strip: over 2 rows, under 2 rows and repeat around the headband. 
• With sewing needle and thread, sew sequins or beads to the crown area that will show most when worn. 
 
The versatile Strip is so easy that you'll want to make more cool stuff. Here are some ideas: 
 
WRIST BAND 
Make the Basic Strip approximately 6" long. Check to see that it will fit comfortably, with a little bit of stretching, around the wrist before fastening off. Fasten off leaving a 10" yarn tail. 
Thread the yarn tail into the yarn needle and sew the ends of the first and last rows together, being careful that the strip is not twisted. 
Jazz up your wristband with weaving yarn strands, sewing sequins, beads, or charms – see Headband. 
 
BELT 
Make the Basic Strip approximately 36" long. Check to see that it will fit comfortably around the waist and still have 6-8" of strip on each side of where you tie it before fastening off. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Add fringe to each end of the belt: cut twelve 6" pieces of yarn – these can be the same color as your belt or any other color you like. Holding 2 pieces together, fold them in half, forming a loop. Insert your crochet hook through one of the stitches at the end of the belt and draw the loop through the fabric, then draw the cut ends through the loop and pull to tighten. Repeat in each stitch on each end of the belt. Trim the fringe so that all the cut ends are even. 
 
Feeling adventurous? Here's another way to make a belt: Make a chain that is 36" long. Then work Basic Strip Row 1 and Row 2 across the chain, then work Row 2 once more and fasten off. And of course you can work it all in the same color or change colors every row! Add beads, fringe, ribbon or whatever suits your mood. 
 
RED HEART® 'Kids™', Art. E711 (5 ounce/290 yard solid color; 4 ounce/232 yard multi color skein.
